Detailed Description

Very simple version of an IntensityMart based directly on cel files for comparison and troubleshooting.

TODO:

  • Constructor with cache files supplied
  • Meta information to check if file matches current file.
  • Multiple caches in case two parts of chip are being accessed at the same time.
  • Ability to specify prefix directory for temp files.
  • Delete Temp files when finished.
  • Measure performance against Harley's HDF5 layer.
  • Ability to store normalized, modified, results to avoid chipstream processing.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DiskIntensityMart::DiskIntensityMart ( const std::vector< int > &  layoutOrder,
const std::vector< std::string > &  celNames,
int  cacheSize,
const std::string &  tempDir,
const std::string &  tempPrefix = "tempcel.",
bool  storeAllCelIntensities = false 
)

Constructor that will build the data files with CEL data reorganized according to the order seen in the ChipLayout object.

Parameters:
layout - Specififes the probesets (ProbeList) and the order that they will be processed in.
celNames - Cel files that will be processed
cacheSize - Size of internal cache to be used.
tempDir - directory to write a5 file
tempPrefix - beginning of filename of a5 file. tempPrefix will be appended with an object-specific code and an .a5 extension
storeAllCelIntensities - if false (default) then only intensities in layoutOrder will be stored. if true then layoutOrder intensities will be stored, followed by remaining cel intensities.
